title: Indian Fans Shout 'Cheaters' As Third Umpire Overrules Snicko To Give Yashasvi Jaiswal Out | Watch - News18
summary:
Indian Fans Shout 'Cheaters' As Third Umpire Overrules Snicko To Give Yashasvi Jaiswal Out | Watch

Date: December 30, 2024

Source: News18

The Boxing Day Test saw a controversial wicket as Yashasvi Jaiswal was adjudged out caught behind by the third umpire, overturning the on-field not-out decision, even when Snicko showed no evidence of an edge.

  • Jaiswal was on the fifth ball of the 71st over when the incident occurred.
  • The on-field umpire Joe Wilson initially ruled not out, leading to an appeal from Australia.
  • Third umpire Sharfuddoula reviewed the footage and decided to overrule, despite no conclusive Snicko evidence.
  • The crowd reacted negatively, with chants of 'cheaters' heard in the stadium.
  • Jaiswal scored 84 before his dismissal, and his wicket contributed to India’s precarious position at 140/7.
“The third umpire had enough evidence to overturn the on-field call, even though Snicko didn’t show any definitive touch.”

The incident has raised questions about the reliability of third umpire decisions and the technology used in similar situations.
newTitle: Indian Fans Shout 'Cheaters' After Yashasvi Jaiswal's Controversial Dismissal

title: India vs Australia Highlights, 4th Test Day 5: AUS beat IND by 184 runs at Melbourne and take 2-1 lead in series - The Indian Express
summary:
India vs Australia Highlights, 4th Test Day 5

Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

Australia beat India by 184 runs in the fourth Test at Melbourne, taking a 2-1 lead in the series.

  • India was chasing 340 runs but collapsed for 155.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal scored 84 runs, but his dismissal changed the game.
  • Pat Cummins and Scott Boland each took three wickets for Australia.
“India won the opening Test in Perth and Australia bounced back at Adelaide. With this win, Australia takes a 2-1 lead.”

The final Test will start in Sydney on Friday, marking a crucial game in the series.
newTitle: India vs Australia Highlights, 4th Test Day 5: AUS beat IND by 184 runs at Melbourne and take 2-1 lead in series

title: Nahi Lag Raha Zor ": 'Exhausted' Jasprit Bumrah's Desperate Plea To Rohit Sharma Goes Viral - NDTV Sports

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: NDTV

Indian fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah pleaded with captain Rohit Sharma, expressing his fatigue after a grueling bowling effort in the fourth Test against Australia. Despite his discomfort, Bumrah's performance was crucial in the match.

  • Bumrah claimed a five-wicket haul against Australia in Melbourne.
  • He bowled 24 overs in the second innings and a total of 53.2 overs in the match.
  • Bumrah was heard on a stump mic saying, 'Bas ab, nahi laga raha zor' (Enough now. I cannot find strength anymore).
  • Former cricketer Simon Katich praised debutant Sam Konstas for his portrayal of Test cricket's challenges.
Video is here. Feel for him https://t.co/B34mC7ffTN — kohlinoor (@cricketxper) December 29, 2024

title: Will Shubman Gill return for Sydney Test? Ex-England bowler thinks coach Gambhir is frustrated with him - The Times of India
summary:
Will Shubman Gill return for Sydney Test? Ex-England bowler thinks coach Gambhir is frustrated with him

Published on: January 3, 2024 Source: Times of India

Former cricketer Monty Panesar discusses Shubman Gill's performance and potential return to the Indian team for the final Test against Australia in Sydney. Gill's inconsistencies have raised concerns about his position in the team.

  • Shubman Gill has been considered a rising star in cricket but has struggled to convert starts into significant scores.
  • He was dropped from the Melbourne Test for all-rounder Washington Sundar.
  • India's batting issues were evident in a defeat by 284 runs in Melbourne.
  • Panesar suggests Gill's average of 35.76 in Tests needs improvement, especially given his talent.
  • Coach Gambhir is reportedly frustrated with Gill's performances.
"He's a better player than that. He shouldn't be averaging just 36 in Test cricket." - Monty Panesar

The outcome of the upcoming Test could determine Gill's place in the squad moving forward, highlighting the competitive nature of the Indian cricket team.

title: Sunil Gavaskar Lashes Out At Seniors Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma After 4th Test Humiliation: "All They.. - NDTV Sports
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar Lashes Out At Seniors Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma After 4th Test Humiliation: "All They Had To Do..."

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: NDTV

The legendary Sunil Gavaskar criticized senior players Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli following India's defeat in the Boxing Day Test against Australia, blaming the top-order for their failure to chase a target of 340 runs.

  • India lost the match by 184 runs, trailing 1-2 in the five-match series.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal was the exception, scoring 84 runs.
  • Gavaskar highlighted the importance of contributions from the top-order players.
  • He suggested that the future of Kohli and Sharma will depend on the selectors' decisions.
“The seniors have not really made the contribution that they should have, all that they had to do was bat out today and live to fight another day in Sydney,” - Sunil Gavaskar.

Gavaskar also praised Jaiswal's performance while criticizing Rishabh Pant's shot selection, which he believes led to the collapse of the batting order.

  • Rishabh Pant's aggressive shot after Tea marked a turning point.

title: Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant and the three shots that sunk India at MCG - The Indian Express
summary:
Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant and the three shots that sunk India at MCG

Publication Date: December 30, 2024

Source: Indian Express

In a disappointing test match at the MCG, India was defeated by Australia by 184 runs, with critical errors from key players leading to their demise. Despite having the chance to potentially win the series, India must now regroup for the next test.

  • Rishabh Pant's poor shot selection cost India dearly in the final session.
  • Virat Kohli's dismissal showcased a lack of discipline, raising questions about his form and future.
  • India's captain Rohit Sharma also contributed to the team's downfall with a mental error.

title: Jacob Duffy lands knockout blows to claim 2-0 series lead - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Jacob Duffy lands knockout blows to claim 2-0 series lead

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: ESPN Cricinfo

New Zealand 186 for 5 (Chapman 42, Hay 41, Robinson 41) beat Sri Lanka 141 (Perera 48, Duffy 4-15) by 45 runs.

In a convincing second T20I victory, New Zealand's comprehensive team effort saw them emerge victorious over Sri Lanka, securing a 2-0 series lead.

  • New Zealand set a target of 187 runs for Sri Lanka, who struggled to achieve it, managing only 141 runs.
  • Jacob Duffy's exceptional bowling performance, taking 4 wickets for just 15 runs, played a crucial role in New Zealand's win.
  • Mitchell Hay was named player of the match for his explosive 41 runs off just 19 balls.
  • Sri Lanka's batting woes continued, with their inability to finish innings strongly raising concerns.
  • Key contributors for Sri Lanka included Kusal Perera and Pathum Nissanka, but their efforts were not enough.
  • New Zealand displayed controlled aggression and effective running between the wickets, significantly outpacing Sri Lanka.
“Duffy's 4 for 15 was far and away the best bowling effort, as he provided crucial breakthroughs across Sri Lanka's innings.”

This victory highlights New Zealand's dominance in the series thus far, leaving Sri Lanka searching for answers as they continue to struggle in away conditions.
newTitle: Jacob Duffy Shines as New Zealand Secures 2-0 Lead Against Sri Lanka

title: 'Kohli deserves a longer rope, can't compare him with Rohit': Sanjay Manjrekar - The Times of India
summary:
Sanjay Manjrekar Supports Virat Kohli Amid Criticism After Test Loss

Date: New Delhi

Source: Times of India

After India's heavy 184-run loss to Australia, former cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar expressed support for Virat Kohli, stating he deserves more time in Test cricket.

  • Criticism surrounds both Kohli and Rohit's performances after the Boxing Day Test.
  • Manjrekar argues that Kohli is a superior Test batter compared to Rohit.
  • He emphasizes the need for the batting coach's role in addressing Kohli's issues.
  • Rohit is viewed as capable but struggling, according to Manjrekar.
  • India faces a challenging 340-run chase with poor performance in critical moments.
“So Virat Kohli obviously deserves a longer rope. It's not so much about Virat Kohli. I want to know what the batting coach of India is doing.” - Sanjay Manjrekar

This commentary from Manjrekar reflects ongoing debates about player performance and team strategies as India looks towards future matches.

summary:
Travis Head's 'Obscene' Finger Celebration Explained After Social Media Furore During MCG Test

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Travis Head's wicket celebration became the center of a social media uproar after he pointed one finger into a circular hand shape, which many perceived as obscene. The incident occurred during Australia's fourth Test against India, leading to discussions around the intention behind the celebration.

  • Travis Head took the wicket of Rishabh Pant, contributing significantly to Australia's victory.
  • The celebration was clarified by Channel 7's James Brayshaw, who referenced a previous statement by Head regarding the 'celebration'.
  • Australia captain Pat Cummins defended Head, explaining the humorous context behind it.
  • India faced a heavy loss with key players, including Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, failing to perform.
  • The match concluded with Australia leading the series 2-1.
“Now, great people in the back have said after he took 4-10 within 17 balls in Sri Lanka in 2022 he was quoted as saying, 'I had to put the digit on ice'.” – Channel 7's James Brayshaw

This celebration has sparked considerable attention and debate on social media, emphasizing the intersection of sports celebrations and public perception.
newTitle: Travis Head's Controversial Finger Celebration During MCG Test Explained

title: Rohit Sharma says poor form ‘mentally disturbing’ after India loses Melbourne Test - The Hindu
summary:
Rohit Sharma Calls Poor Form 'Mentally Disturbing' After Australia's Victory in Fourth Test

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

After India's defeat against Australia in the fourth Test, captain Rohit Sharma expressed his disappointment over the team's performance and acknowledged the mental toll it has taken on him.

  • India lost the fourth Test against Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
  • Rohit mentioned that the team had opportunities to draw the game but failed to capitalize.
  • He described his struggles as a batter, stating that many things are not falling into place and that it is 'mentally disturbing.'
  • Looking forward, Rohit emphasized the importance of playing well in the upcoming match in Sydney to aim for a series draw.
  • He addressed questions about Rishabh Pant's dismissals and the management of Jasprit Bumrah's bowling workload.
  • Rohit praised the performance of Nitish Kumar and recognized the hard work of Mohammed Siraj and Akash Deep.
“Obviously, few results have not gone our way and as a captain, it is disappointing. As a batter, a lot of the things I am trying to do are not falling in place. Mentally, look, it is disturbing.”

Rohit's insights reflect the challenges faced by the Indian team and highlight the mental aspects of performance in competitive sports.
newTitle: Rohit Sharma Calls Poor Form 'Mentally Disturbing' After Australia's Victory in Fourth Test

title: Shortlist for Sir Garfield Sobers Trophy for Men’s Cricketer of the Year announced - ICC Cricket
summary:
Shortlist for Sir Garfield Sobers Trophy for Men’s Cricketer of the Year announced

Publication Date: N/A | Source: N/A

The shortlist for the Sir Garfield Sobers Trophy, honoring the Men’s Cricketer of the Year, has been revealed. The nominees include Harry Brook, Jasprit Bumrah, Joe Root, and Travis Head, each with outstanding performances throughout the year.

  • Harry Brook (England): 1100 runs from 12 Tests, average 55.00, Highest Score 317
  • Jasprit Bumrah (India): 71 wickets from 13 Tests, average 14.92; 15 wickets from 8 T20Is, average 8.26
  • Joe Root (England): 1556 runs from 17 Tests, average 55.57, Highest Score 262
  • Travis Head (Australia): 608 runs from 9 Tests, average 40.53; 539 runs from 15 T20Is, strike rate 178.47
“Harry Brook emerged as one of England’s most reliable performers...”

The nominees represent a mix of aggressive batting and pivotal roles in their respective teams, showcasing their skills in a variety of cricket formats.
newTitle: Shortlist for Sir Garfield Sobers Trophy for Men’s Cricketer of the Year announced

title: "Third Umpire Did Make...": On Yashasvi Jaiswal Controversy, Simon Taufel's Blunt Verdict - NDTV Sports
summary:
Yashasvi Jaiswal's Controversial Dismissal: Simon Taufel's Verdict

Date & Source: December 30, 2024 | NDTV Sports

India opener Yashasvi Jaiswal's contentious dismissal sparked a controversy on the final day of the fourth Test against Australia at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. Jaiswal was given out caught behind despite no clear edge being shown on the Snicko. The decision was made by third umpire Saikat Sharfuddoula, overturning the on-field umpire's not out call. Jaiswal, batting on 84, argued with the umpires before walking back.

  • Jaiswal was dismissed on 84 after a solid innings of 208 deliveries.
  • The dismissal led to chants of "cheater" around the MCG.
  • The incident follows a similar controversy in the opening Test in Perth involving opener KL Rahul.
"Yeh optical illusion hai." - Sunil Gavaskar questions the third umpire's decision to overrule the Snicko technology.

Former ICC Elite Panel umpire Simon Taufel told Channel 7 that the third umpire made the correct decision to overrule the on-field umpire's not out call based on clear deflection off the bat.

This incident has reignited the debate around the use of technology in making decisions in cricket.
newTitle: Yashasvi Jaiswal's Controversial Dismissal: Simon Taufel's Verdict

title: 'No comparison between Rohit and Kohli', Indian captain 'looking down in doldrums': Manjrekar hits the nail on its head - Hindustan Times
summary:
No comparison between Rohit and Kohli: Manjrekar's take on Indian cricket

Publication Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

In light of recent performances, former Indian cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar argues that comparing Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli is unfair, highlighting the need for Kohli to be given more chances despite his struggles.

  • Manjrekar states Kohli deserves a longer rope than Rohit following their disappointing performances against Australia.
  • Rohit averaged only 31 runs in the current series against Australia, with his scores being 3, 6, 10, 3, and 9.
  • Kohli has faced criticism for getting out to the same type of deliveries repeatedly.
  • Manjrekar criticizes the batting coach for not addressing Kohli's consistent issues with his technique.
“I must say there is no comparison between Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli as Test batters. Virat Kohli is right up there. He's a great Test batter, and Rohit Sharma is a good Test batter.” - Sanjay Manjrekar

The commentary on the performance of these key players raises questions about the future direction of Indian cricket leadership and selection.
newTitle: No comparison between Rohit and Kohli: Manjrekar's take on Indian cricket

FIDE CEO responds to Magnus Carlsen’s ‘f*** you’ rant: ‘I know no less colourful words than him’

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: The Indian Express

Magnus Carlsen and FIDE have resolved their dispute, allowing Carlsen to participate in the FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Championship in New York following a controversial fine for attire.

  • Carlsen expressed frustration over a fine for wearing jeans during the rapid section of the tournament.
  • In a prior statement, Carlsen used expletives to convey his displeasure with FIDE's rules.
  • FIDE CEO Emil Sutovsky acknowledged the situation, emphasizing that personal attacks are not constructive.
  • Sutovsky defended his role, citing improvements in tournament organization under his leadership.
  • Carlsen criticized FIDE's former player representative, Viswanathan Anand, suggesting he wasn't fit for the role.
“If the question is how I respond to Magnus’ words, I know no less colourful words than him, trust me.” - Emil Sutovsky

The incident underscores ongoing tensions within the chess community regarding FIDE's regulations and leadership dynamics.

summary:
Captain Cry Baby: After Virat Kohli Row, Australian Media Hits New Low With Rohit Sharma Jibe

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: NDTV

The Australian media has targeted Indian captain Rohit Sharma over his frustrated reaction to young teammate Yashasvi Jaiswal dropping three catches during the Boxing Day Test. This follows prior criticism directed at Virat Kohli over a separate incident.

  • The West Australian tabloid labeled Rohit as 'Captain Cry Baby' after he expressed visible frustration with Jaiswal's poor fielding.
  • Rohit's body language was scrutinized by former players, emphasizing the need for support towards younger teammates.
  • Despite Jaiswal usually being a reliable fielder, he faced backlash for the dropped catches, leading to tensions within the team.
“I've got to be honest, I don't like that reaction from the Indian skipper... You don't need to see that as a young player.” — Mike Hussey

title: Rohit Sharma to retire from Tests after Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Sydney? Report suggests India captain is trying to… - Mint
Rohit Sharma on Yashasvi Jaiswal’s controversial DRS dismissal: ’Don’t know how umpires want to use technology’ - Mint
summary:
Rohit Sharma Comments on Controversial DRS Dismissal of Yashasvi Jaiswal

Date: December 30, 2024   Source: Live Mint

India captain Rohit Sharma raised concerns about the use of technology in cricket after Yashasvi Jaiswal's controversial dismissal in the fourth Test against Australia, which resulted in India's defeat.

During the match, Jaiswal was given out despite no clear evidence of a contact with the ball, leading to confusion and frustration.

  • Jaiswal was batting on 84 when he was controversially given out.
  • The Indian batting lineup faltered, getting all out for 155 runs.
  • Rohit Sharma expressed his doubts regarding the accuracy of DRS technology.
  • India's loss resulted in a significant setback for their World Test Championship hopes.
“I don't know what to make of (that decision) because the technology didn't show anything but with naked eye it seem that he did touch something,” - Rohit Sharma

In conclusion, the incident has sparked a debate on the reliability of DRS in cricket, particularly in high-stakes matches.

Anushka Sharma and Athiya Shetty, wives of Indian cricket team players Virat Kohli and KL Rahul, were recently seen at the Melbourne Cricket Ground for the fourth test match between India and Australia. Their reactions to their husbands' early dismissals during the game have gone viral on social media.
